Event Type: Object Storage Infrastructure Maintenance
Start Time: 2023-11-01 09:00:00 America/Los_Angeles
End Time: 2023-11-01 17:0:00 America/Los_Angeles

Our Cloud Storage team will be performing upgrades to our Silicon Valley Object Storage infrastructure starting at 2023-11-01 16:10:00 UTC. During this maintenance window, creating, accessing, gets, puts, and deletes of Object Storage services may be temporarily unavailable.

Previously deployed Object Storage subscriptions in Silicon Valley will remain online without interruption and will not be impacted by this event.

Event Type: Storage Infrastructure Maintenance
Start Time: 2023-10-31 09:00:00 America/Los_Angeles
End Time: 2023-10-31 18:00:00 America/Los_Angeles

Our Cloud Storage team will be performing upgrades to our Silicon Valley deployment infrastructure starting at 2023-10-31 16:00:00 UTC. During this maintenance window, new deployments, snapshot functionality, HDD Block devices, and custom ISOs may be temporarily unavailable.

Previously deployed servers in Silicon Valley will remain online without interruption and will not be impacted by this event.

Some customers are currently experiencing slower than normal instance deployment times in all locations. Our engineering team is aware of this issue and is working diligently to resolve this as quickly as possible.

Move all services and TOR connections from sr1/sr2.sea3(10k2) to new install 10k8
Maintenance completed all services moved to the new sr1 10k8

Event Type: Network Upgrade

We are performing system changes in the Seattle location during the following scheduled maintenance window. 

Start Time: 2023-10-26 07:00:00 UTC

We schedule higher impact maintenance events during off-peak times to maintain our ideal hosting environment. Our engineers make every effort to minimize system impact; however, Seattle instances may be unreachable for some, or all, of the scheduled maintenance window as we perform network, firmware, or host upgrades.

service_alerts.subject: Potential service disruption in Tel Aviv

entries.message:
The Constant Company, creator of Vultr, is aware of and following the situation in Israel. At this time we do not expect any disruption of service in our Tel Aviv location.  We will continue to closely monitor services as the situation evolves, and we will advise our customers of any changes which have the potential to impact service delivery.

We believe this is a crucial time to remind our customers about the importance of the 3-2-1 Backup Strategy for safeguarding all critical data. Please see the case study here for more information: https://www.vultr.com/docs/case-study-use-a-321-backup-strategy-at-vultr/

Please note that Vultr Snapshots and Backups are stored in the same location as the instance they are made from, however when you deploy a new instance from them in a different location, they will be automatically transferred and stored in the new location as well.
